input.selected_rq: How do group coordination patterns mediate the relationship between system latency and users' perceived quality of real-time collaboration?

tension.dominant_assumption: Performance optimization in collaborative systems is primarily a technical infrastructure problem solvable through better algorithms and architecture.
tension.blind_spot: The role of human coordination patterns and social dynamics in shaping perceived latency and collaboration quality.
tension.core_gap: We lack a conceptual framework that integrates sociotechnical factors into the understanding of 'real-time' in collaborative editing.

expected_output.contribution: This study develops a sociotechnical model of perceived latency in collaborative editing, revealing how group coordination dynamics — not just network delay — shape users' real-time experience.

input.selected_rq: How do first-generation students make sense of the tensions between their cultural identities and institutional expectations of academic belonging?

tension.dominant_assumption: Academic identity development follows a relatively uniform trajectory that can be supported through standard institutional interventions.
tension.blind_spot: The epistemic labour first-generation students perform in translating between home and academic knowledge systems.
tension.core_gap: There is insufficient understanding of how first-generation students construct academic identities at the intersection of cultural, class-based, and institutional discourses.

expected_output.contribution: This study offers a typology of identity negotiation strategies used by first-generation students, surfacing the previously invisible epistemic labour of navigating between competing knowledge systems.

input.selected_rq: What would a framework for evaluating K-12 AI literacy look like if it accounted for both technical competency and critical-reflective understanding?

tension.dominant_assumption: AI literacy can be adequately assessed using competency-based frameworks adapted from digital or computational literacy.
tension.blind_spot: The ethical and epistemic dimensions of AI literacy — understanding not just how AI works, but what it means for knowledge and agency.
tension.core_gap: No existing evaluation framework captures both the technical and critical-reflective dimensions of AI literacy in developmentally appropriate ways for K-12 learners.

expected_output.contribution: This study proposes an integrated AI literacy evaluation framework for K-12 contexts that bridges technical competency assessment with critical-reflective dimensions currently absent from existing models.
